abstract: RAND corporation study, commissioned by Defense Sec Ashton B Carter, finds no reason to prohibit transgender people from serving openly in armed forces; warns against costs of not providing transition-related health care; Pentagon stalls on making policy change amid contentious national debate over discrimination against transgender people.
lead_paragraph: A study commissioned by the Pentagon found that a small portion of service members are transgender and allowing them to serve openly would cost little.

headline.main: Study Finds Few Obstacles to Lifting Military’s Transgender Ban
headline.print_headline: Few Obstacles Found to Lifting Military’s Transgender Ban

snippet: A study commissioned by the Pentagon found that a small portion of service members are transgender and allowing them to serve openly would cost little.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
